Your diplomats have returned from the Brotherhood of Dawn with Primordial Affinity.

Nothing should be able to live in the Salt Deserts of Morkaï, and yet something does. Below the Tower of Salt, a circle of blind monks toils in the mines. The diamonds that they collect are the very same that fortify the Radiant Fleet. The monks warn merchant caravans from entering the caves, claiming they are home to an evil that only they are shielded from. Figures of women and men in anguish stand inside, sculpted in sand. Any enterprise taken towards the diamond mines should be carefully considered. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Gems and Genesis Stones.

Your diplomats were met by a group of Monks on the edge of the Salt Desert. They provided escort, using their walking sticks to check for any unusual vibrations. A number of detours had to be taken, to avoid the legendary creature worming below the surface. When questioned, they would not utter its name, for doing so is akin to summoning a demon, they said. They reached the Diamond Mines without further incident and brought back a wealth of gems.
Your diplomats returned from the Diamond Mines with Gems.

Rumour tells of an inn where strange folk go. Depending on who tells the story, you’ll find it at the edge of the world, or at the corner of your street when the wind changes on a new moon. In either case, it’s no place for a mortal. The Landlady opens her door to fey types and grants them shelter around a dim candlelight. One shudders to think how they’d react to an interruption. Those who claim to have walked by describe the rattling of the walls and howling inside the house, culminating in a moment where all sound goes mute. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Ethereal Reagents.

Your representatives have returned safely from their journey to the Whisper’s Rest Inn. The landlady welcomed them with open arms; she knew what they were there for. Once pleasantries were exchanged, she led them down to the cellar. She conducted some ritual, and at one point your diplomats swore they were about to be sacrificed to the monsters of the abyss. Alas, they needn’t have worried. Once the ritual was complete, the lady of the Inn gave them Ethereal Reagents as an offering to the regent of Stormfall.
Your diplomats have returned from Whisper’s Rest Inn with Ethereal Reagents.

Your diplomats have returned from their mission. In the end, they were unable to make it to their destination. They did, however, come upon another wandering caravan while out on the roads, and were able to make a small trade, so the journey was not a complete waste.
Your diplomats did not reach their destination, but still managed to conduct some trade.

Your diplomats were unable to reach their intended destination. After torrential rainfall, the wagons drove straight into a thick mire. Despite their best efforts, the wagons had to be left behind. They managed to recover a fraction of what they had taken with them, loaded onto the horses, and were able to make some smaller trades with the villages they passed through on the way home.
Your diplomats did not reach their destination, but still managed to conduct some trade.

After reaching their destination and parking their wagons, the local leaders approached your diplomats, excessively apologetic. Apparently, even though they valued their ties with Stormfall dearly, they found themselves unable to give as much as they would have liked to your diplomats. Little could be done to change their minds, and so the diplomats returned, not with what they had hoped, but something to show nonetheless.
Your diplomats did not reach their destination, but still managed to conduct some trade.

While en route to their destination, your diplomats were chased off the beaten track by bandits. After finding a suitable spot to lay low, the Thunderblades escorting the caravan set up an ambush. They were swift and ruthless and managed to take a number of the bandits as hostages, including, they discerned, the son of a bandit chieftain. After being escorted to the bandit camp, your diplomats were able to trade the son for a hefty ransom.
Your diplomats did not reach their destination, but still managed to conduct some trade.

Your diplomats were buffeted off course by tempestuous winds and the wrathful waves of the open ocean. Despite their misfortune, they ran aground on an island, encountering a small commune. They were not quite used to visitors; and seeing the strange, alien objects owned by the diplomats, they were eager to trade some of their own belongings.
Your diplomats did not reach their destination, but still managed to conduct some trade.

Your diplomats have returned, but not from their intended destination. After sailing for a number of days, they were intercepted by a small fleet of Republic ships. Your diplomats were led to a nearby Republican outpost, where they were questioned on their cargo and their destination. After discerning the contents of the ships, the Republic demanded a trade, albeit at a reduced rate to what your diplomats were expecting.
Your diplomats did not reach their destination, but still managed to conduct some trade.

While out on the open seas, your diplomats came across a small merchant convoy, traveling in the same direction. After signaling, your diplomats had their ship anchored alongside the merchants, and after a short discussion, realized that they were carrying valuable cargo. They proved willing to trade it to, leaving the diplomats happy enough to return to Stormfall without reaching their intended destination.
Your diplomats did not reach their destination, but still managed to conduct some trade.

Part-way to their destination, a pirate ship emerged from a cove to pursue your diplomats. Desperate to escape, they had to abandon their current course and turn around for Stormfall. They were followed into a storm, and when they emerged, they noticed the pirate ship sinking. Unable to believe their luck, your diplomats turned the ship around, allowing a couple of survivors to be brought on board as captives. In exchange for their lives, the pirates led the diplomats to their buried treasure.
Your diplomats did not reach their destination, but still managed to conduct some trade.

The time has long passed for your diplomats’ return. They should have been back in Stormfall weeks ago. With no news from them at this point in time, it is safe to assume that they are never coming back
Your diplomats did not returned from their mission.

After arriving at their destination, feet weary and dust scratching at their lungs, your diplomats entered negotiations. Unfortunately for them, negotiations were long and protracted, and no consensus could be reached with the local leaders. In the end, your diplomats were forced to return to Stormfall with nothing to show for their troubles.

Despite arriving at their destination in good time, negotiations with the local leaders did not go as well as your diplomats would have hoped. One of your diplomats, perhaps who had missed the briefing before departure, made some gesture or other that offended the sensibilities of the locals. Consequently, no trade was made, and your diplomats returned empty-handed.

After mooring their ship at their intended destination, your diplomats met with the local leaders. Talks went on for hours, beginning in the morning and stretching to the early hours of the following morning. Realizing that no consensus could be reached, your diplomats made the return journey to Stormfall, their ship lighter than they would have liked.

The sailing had been hard-going for your diplomats, meaning that they arrived at their destination much later than intended. The local leaders, offended by this tardiness, decided to not be forthcoming with the goods they could offer. Consequently, your diplomats were forced to sail home empty-handed.

Many of Stormfall’s land-based trade routes are little more than dirt paths. This slows down the progress of caravans looking to trade, especially during wet weather, as their wagons often get bogged down in the mud. If you were to invest in stone-cobbled roads, progress would be far easier, making trade partners more likely to invest more time and money exporting their goods to Stormfall. Outcomes:

Productivity will be permanently increased.
Roadworks have been completed, making it easier and faster for caravans to reach Stormfall. This should encourage your trade partners to send caravans with increasing frequency from now on.
Roadworks have been completed, boosting Stormfall’s Productivity.

Despite being surrounded by water, Stormfall struggles to supply its citizens with a reliable supply of clean drinking water. The city has relied on a local river that runs into the sea nearby, but years of pollution from the sewers have riddled the river’s water with disease. The river’s source lies quite a distance upstream, but if you were to build an aqueduct connecting its water to Stormfall, the risk of disease would be reduced tremendously. Outcomes:

Productivity will be permanently increased.

Construction work on the new Aqueduct has been completed, giving Stormfall access to a new, clean water source. With clean water flowing through the city, they are now less likely to contract water-borne diseases.
The Aqueduct has been completed, boosting Stormfall’s Productivity.

Sanitation in Stormfall has always been an issue that has plagued its citizens. The sewer system is a relic of another era, barely able to cope with the population within Stormfall’s walls, even despite the recent deaths incurred on its people. Sewage flows downward, making the spread of disease worse in the lower ring. If the sewers were expanded and made to re-direct the sewage off the streets, the risk of disease should fall and thus strengthen the city’s work-force. Outcomes:

Productivity will be permanently increased.

Renovation work on the sewers has finished. The flow of the city’s waste no longer goes through the city’s streets, where it is most likely to fester and spread disease among your citizens. With the streets cleaned up, your citizens are less likely to contract diseases.
Sewer Renovations have been completed, boosting Stormfall’s Productivity.

Stormfall’s farmers rely heavily on persistent rains to irrigate their fields. However, the region does have its dry seasons, increasing the risk of crop failure and making it difficult to keep up with the demand of Stormfall’s population. If you were to build a network of canals connecting one of the rivers to the fields, this would make crop yields far more reliable, ensuring Stormfall’s citizens have enough food all year round. Outcomes:

Productivity will be permanently increased.

New Irrigation Networks have finished being developed in the Farmlands. With a steady and consistent flow of water irrigating their fields, farmers can be more certain of the yields that their fields will produce. The citizens of Stormfall shall be better fed as a result.
Irrigation Networks have been completed, boosting Stormfall’s Productivity.

A recent innovation in agricultural practice has been brought to your attention. Currently, your farmers grow the same crop in the same field every year. In the Republic, however, they rotate which crops are grown on a field in any given year. This means that different nutrients from the soil are used during each rotation, allowing the soil to stay fertile for longer. If your farmers were to adopt this practice, yields were more consistent, providing a greater supply of food to the city. Outcomes:

Productivity will be permanently increased.

Your farmers have been trained in the agricultural practice of crop rotation. With different crops being grown in the same field every year, the nutrients required for each crop are able to replenish themselves in the soil when they are not being absorbed. This makes yields more reliable and the citizens feel more secure knowing they will be well fed.
Your farmers have been taught Crop Rotation, boosting Stormfall’s Productivity

Much of Stormfall’s poorer population rely on the steady flow of cheap staple foods into the city. One such staple is bread, which requires flour to produce. Currently, Stormfall does not have enough windmills to grind the amount of grain needed to make flour, meaning that providing enough bread for the population is difficult. If you were to invest in a new network of windmills, less of your citizens would go hungry. Outcomes:

Productivity will be permanently increased.

A network of Windmills has finished construction, meaning that grain can be ground efficiently and in large quantities. With more grain available, more bread can be produced to feed the poorest workers of Stormfall's society, increasing the morale of the work-force.
Windmills have been completed, boosting Stormfall’s Productivity.

On past occasions where Stormfall underwent a crisis, the city was unable to provide enough care for the wounded. Even during times of peace, raids in the surrounding countryside ensure that there is a steady supply of citizens coming to the city seeking aid, only to be turned away. If you were to invest in a trauma center to look after the sick and wounded, more of your citizens would be able to return to the work-force in good time. Outcomes:

Productivity will be permanently increased.

A new Trauma Center has been established in Stormfall. Your citizens feel more secure in the knowledge that if disaster does strike Stormfall, the city now has the proper facilities to tend to their wounds.
The Trauma Center has been completed, boosting Stormfall’s Productivity.

Work-related deaths in Stormfall are incredibly high. The number of citizens in the work-force seems to be decreasing, and the citizens that do work are chronically exhausted, unable to function at full capacity. If you were to introduce new laws pertaining to working conditions, perhaps restricting the number of hours worked, with mandatory break periods and food supplied, your workers would be more productive. Outcomes:

Productivity will be permanently increased.

The new legislation regarding working conditions has been passed, ensuring that all workers have access to a safe and considerate work environment. Knowing that the city of Stormfall appreciates their work, the work-force continues to grow in its efficiency.
Working Conditions have been improved, boosting Stormfall’s Productivity.

Stormfall once had some of the best training facilities on the continent, perfect for conditioning the city guards, Seekers, and the elite force of Thunderblades that protect the city’s interests. Recent events have left these facilities and their training equipment in a sorry state. If you were to invest in new, perhaps improved training facilities, more new recruits could be drafted into the ranks of Stormfall’s military organizations, increasing security in all corners of the city-state. Outcomes:

Productivity will be permanently increased. The Project "Renovate Seekers Garrison" will become available.

Stormfall’s new training facilities were built successfully. These should increase the quality of new recruits exponentially in the future. As a further consequence, it is now feasible for Stormfall to invest in re-invigorating its Seeker initiative.
Training Facilities completed, boosting Productivity and allowing Seekers Garrison renovations.

In the past Stormfall’s educational institutions produced some of the greatest minds on the continent. However, due to a steady decline in these services provided by the city, the brightest of Stormfall’s young have been sent abroad to pursue their passions and learn their trades. If you were to invest in reinvigorating Stormfall’s educational institutions, more of Stormfall’s young would stay to lend their talents to the city’s enterprises in the future. Outcomes:

Productivity will be permanently increased.

Work has been completed on improving Stormfall’s educational institutions. More apprenticeships are on offer, allowing more young people to learn their trades in the city. A new university has also been established, giving rise to a new breed of intellectuals that are pushing the boundaries of what can be achieved through all manner of innovations. This has given Stormfall’s industries a renewed vigor.
Educational Institutions have been improved, boosting Stormfall’s Productivity.

Stormfall relies on a consistent supply of wood for a number of its enterprises. Currently, the city does not have an efficient way of cutting logs into lumber for use in the construction of farmhouses, barns, and ships, just to name a few. If you were to invest in the construction of some new sawmills, Stormfall would be able to produce lumber at a much faster rate, making projects that require a lot of wood more feasible. Outcomes:

Productivity will be permanently increased.

A new network of Sawmills has been established in the country around Stormfall. With this development, the city is now able to produce increasing quantities of lumber at greater efficiency, re-vitalizing Stormfall’s construction efforts wherever they may be.
Sawmills have been completed, boosting Stormfall’s Productivity.

Iron is a staple resource for any city. Stormfall relies on a steady supply of iron to forge new weapons, rivets for ship-building, and plates for the roofs of each of its buildings. There are some deposits of iron not far from Stormfall, located in the Highlands. If you were to construct some new equipment and hire some miners for the job, Stormfall would have to rely far less on foreign imports and would have easy access to iron for the city’s needs. Outcomes:

Productivity will be permanently increased.

The excavation of a new iron mine has been completed, bringing in a steady supply of iron into Stormfall. Now with this reliable source of iron, the city’s projects are no longer bottlenecked by having to wait for the appropriate import of materials.
Iron Mines have been excavated, boosting Stormfall’s Productivity.

Rock is one of the most important resources for any city wishing to expand its territory and its reach. Cobble roads make for a better connection with trade partners, bricks make housing more robust against the fury of the elements. If you were to invest in the excavation of a new quarry, Stormfall’s expansion efforts could be increased several-fold. Outcomes:

Productivity will be permanently increased.

The stone quarry has now been excavated, allowing Stormfall to have quick and easy access to a supply of stone for all of its construction needs. Given how many of Stormfall’s construction plans rely on a steady supply of stone, this should make those projects more feasible going forward.
The Stone Quarry has been excavated, boosting Stormfall’s Productivity.

The poorest of Stormfall’s citizens, those in the lower ring, form the bulk of the city’s work-force. Many of them live in abject poverty, holes in their roofs and the spray from the sea seeping into their homes. As such, illness immobilizes and kills countless men and women who would otherwise be working to support their families. If you were to invest in a housing initiative that improved their living standards, your work-force would be significantly strengthened. Outcomes:

Productivity will be permanently increased.

The new housing initiative was a success, with new, improved housing being built in the poorest areas of the city. This has given your citizens a new sense of security, as they no longer have to worry about the elements breaching their ramshackle homes, and can instead focus on their work and their lives.
The Housing Initiative has been completed, boosting Stormfall’s Productivity.

The approach to Stormfall’s docks is a treacherous one. To aid trade ships with their approach, Stormfall’s lighthouse would serve as a beacon, warning ships of the difficult terrain that lay ahead. After being buffeted by storms for centuries, the lighthouse is now in a state of disrepair, meaning that trade with Stormfall is a risky affair by sea. If you were to renovate the lighthouse, it would go a long way in strengthening trade ties with other cities. Outcomes:

Productivity will be permanently increased.

Renovation work on Stormfall’s lighthouse has been completed. It is once again a shining beacon to Stormfall’s trade partners, guiding them through the Coast of Wrecks and into the safety of Stormfall’s docks. Now that the lighthouse is complete, less inbound ships are likely to be destroyed when delivering their cargo, meaning that more wealth will flow through Stormfall.
The Lighthouse has been renovated, boosting Stormfall’s Productivity.

There has been very little to sing and dance about in Stormfall as of late. Very little in the way of entertainment has provided your citizens with an outlet for their troubles. If you were to invest in a new theater company and hire performers to put on a show every once in a while, the joy it would bring to your citizens could have a positive effect on their morale and happiness, improving their productivity in the long-term. Outcomes:

Productivity will be permanently increased.

The new theater has finished construction, with shows scheduled to occur on a weekly basis. With a new distraction to entertain them after a tough week of work, the citizens of Stormfall leave the shows re-energized for the week of work to come.
The Theater has been constructed, boosting Stormfall’s Productivity.

With the surge of energy beneath Stormfall in Anankis, numerous tremors cracked open the land surrounding Stormfall. From these cracks emerged all manner of monsters from below, harassing the local population and making the job of a farmer far more dangerous than it should ever need to be. If you were to invest in an initiative to close these rifts, the country surrounding Stormfall would be much safer, allowing your citizens to conduct their work without the fear of being eaten alive. Outcomes:

Productivity will be permanently increased.

The Rift Initiative had some difficulties, but in the end, the rifts opened in Stormfall’s countryside were closed. Citizens living in the farmland are no longer fearful of the creatures that might be lurking in the undergrowth. With fewer casualties being suffered, your farmers can do their job in peace and toil the fields at a higher capacity.
The Rift Initiative has been completed, boosting Stormfall’s Productivity.

Stormfall is no stranger to disaster. The weather is temperamental, and the city’s namesake is a constant threat to its people. Farmland floods often enough for it to be a constant pressure, and citizens are often displaced by persistent Flayer raids on top of the flooding. If you were to invest in creating supply stockpiles around the city, this would offset to consequences of such upheavals, and allow the city to continue functioning during times of crisis. Outcomes:

Productivity will be permanently increased.

Supply stockpiles have been established all over Stormfall, ensuring that every one of its citizens has access to emergency supplies should disaster strike and they are displaced from their livelihoods. With this reassurance, your citizens feel better able to conduct their work without worrying about their futures.
Supply Stockpiles have been established, boosting Stormfall’s Productivity.

The world of Wolcen is a dangerous place, making travel a risky endeavor for anyone wishing to reach other places and cities. Raiders, like wolves, stalk trade routes in the hopes of encountering easy prey. If you were to set up armed checkpoints along the routes leading into Stormfall, there would less chance of approaching caravans being torn apart before being able to share their goods. Outcomes:

Productivity will be permanently increased.

Military checkpoints have finished being set up along Stormfall’s most important trade routes. Reassured by Stormfall’s commitment to protecting their caravans, the city’s trade partners are more eager than ever to trade their goods with the Jewel of the Sea.
Military Checkpoints have been established, boosting Stormfall’s Productivity.

As the uses of energy from crystals becomes ever more apparent, the demand for it has been rising exponentially. From mechanizing processes to powering weaponry like Stormfall’s Radiant Turrets, energy crystals are the key to the future growth of any city and Stormfall should be at the forefront of this growth. If you were to invest in an increased effort to excavate energy crystals, Stormfall could lead the way in technological and industrial innovation. Outcomes:

Productivity will be permanently increased.

Excavation work has been completed and a new energy crystal mine has been established. With this new source of energy to take advantage of, Stormfall does not have to worry about the feasibility of creating new, energy-dependent equipment and weaponry, or worry about its existing equipment from becoming obsolete.
The Energy Crystal mine has been excavated, boosting Stormfall’s Productivity.

Despite there being a variety of new initiatives being proposed throughout the city, such initiatives require careful planning before they can be feasibly undertaken. The Council has recommended that a 'Planning Comittee' be established to oversee the management of city projects. By doing so, they hope to ensure that resources are invested wisely and efficiently, thus allowing the city to have more projects ongoing at any one time. Outcomes:

The following Projects will become available: "Construct Enneract Lab", "Construct Bank". Your Maximum Active projects will be increased by 1.

The Planning Committee was established, put together from a number of craftsmen, architects, and noble representatives throughout Stormfall. Should you wish, you can now construct the Diamond Bank and the Enneract Laboratory. What is more, resource allocation should now be more efficient, making it feasible to conduct more city projects than previously thought possible.
The Planning Committee has been established; new initiatives are awaiting your investment.

The Planning Committee wishes to expand its capabilities even further to support new projects throughout the city. They believe they can improve on some of their processes, and want the work-force to undergo the necessary training to make this a reality. Outcomes:

The following Projects will become available: "Renovate Trade Assembly", "Construct Instillator", and "Construct Siphon Chamber". Your Maximum Active projects will be increased by 1.

The Planning Committee has completed its training, meaning that a number of new initiatives are now awaiting your investment. Should you wish, you can now renovate Stormfall’s Trade Assembly, and construct two of Demetra’s new devices: her Siphon Chamber and her Energy Instillator. What is more, resource allocation should now be more efficient, making it feasible to conduct more city projects than previously thought possible.
The Planning Committee has completed its training; new initiatives are awaiting your investment.

The Planning Comittee wishes to expand its capabilities even further to support new projects throughout the city. They believe they can improve on some of their processes, and want the work-force to undergo the necessary training to make this a reality. Outcomes:

The following Projects will become available: "Construct Transmutation Forge", "Renovate Shipyard", and the Dark Market Project "Establish Contact: 'The Curator'". Your Maximum Active projects will be increased by 1.

The Planning Committee has completed its training, meaning that a number of new initiatives are now awaiting your investment. Should you wish, you can now construct Demetra’s Transmutation Forge, renovate Stormfall’s Shipyard, and begin establishing contacts within the Dark Market. What is more, resource allocation should now be more efficient, making it feasible to conduct more city projects than previously thought possible.
The Planning Committee has completed its training; new initiatives are awaiting your investment.

When an item is placed in the forge, not even Demetra knows what the forge will spit back out. All she knows is that it will take a different form, and its properties will change completely from what they once were. Outcomes:

Your chosen item will be transformed into another item

After a while, the item you placed within the Transmutation Forge became something completely different. Demetra was delighted with the results, and could not wait for you to receive the newly transmuted item.

In order to extract magical energy from your body, Demetra first needs to calibrate the siphon chamber for you. Once calibrated, she will strap you in and draw out your energy, giving you gold in return. Outcomes:

Your selected amount of Primordial Affinity will be converted into Gold.

Once the Siphon Chamber was calibrated, Demetra strapped you inside and began the siphoning process. When you emerged, you felt a little weakened, but the pouch of gold Demetra gave you more than made up for the whole ordeal.
Demetra has siphoned Primordial Affinity from your body and given you gold in return.

In order to transfer magical energy from her stores into your body, Demetra will first need to calibrate the Energy Instillator’s seating unit. Once calibrated, she will strap you in to the seat and infuse your body with magical energy. Outcomes:

Your selected amount of Gold will be converted into Primordial Affinity.

After calibrating the Energy Instillator, Demetra hooked you up to its seat and her stores of magical energy. You felt a surge of energy course through your arms and into your chest, filling you with a renewed vigor. You gave Demetra her gold, and went on your way.
Demetra instilled your body with Primordial Affinity in return for the gold you gave her.

The Curator has access to a large supply of Ethereal Reagents, but procuring them for you will have a cost, both in terms of time and resources. You will have to provide the appropriate offering for the Curator if they are to complete this undertaking. Outcomes:

Loot received: Ethereal Reagent
Mohabi enlisted the services of the Curator who, after a time, was able to procure the Ethereal Reagent you requested.
The Curator procured a Ethereal Reagent for you.

Stormfall’s representatives in foreign states have returned to report on current affairs. They have leads, and sometimes, offerings, to bring to your attention. They invite you to have a look at what they have.

The bow handle is engraved with an elegant symbol, a blazing phoenix with purple eyes. Closer inspection reveals thirteen small markings on the bow wings, as if the previous owner was keeping track of a grim score. Whoever it was, its legacy is not meant to end here: time to start big game hunting and keep the death toll rolling.

"The combat was fierce, but Brother Amren eventually met his end, crushed by the demon as his lifeless body was thrown across Greyharbour’s street. Yet, hope was not to die with the battle-priest. One of the four fishermen he was defending stepped forward and picked-up his shield to continue the fight. With him, the three other common-men charged the wounded demon while shouting their fear away. Neither the fishermen nor the demon survived the battle. An ode to these men’s sacrifice was engraved by the Brotherhood of Dawn on the edges of Amren’s aegis. This beacon of hope now awaits a new bearer worthy to keep up the fight against evil."

There is one city that makes the best steel in the four realms: Vulcaïn. This city-state is nested inside a Volcano which grants their deepest forge the temperature needed to melt, blend and purify the best metals. The resulting steel becomes pure, strong and extremely sharp. To defend the city, their elite infantry are given rough jagged versions which captured some of the lava they were forged in.

Those who made a pact with Anulaï-Taï, Fallen Duke of Infinity, may rise inside the cult’s hierarchy and become a dreaded Time Devourer. Those sorcerers phase through space motionlessly while using their Time Seal to harness and destroy the normal continuum around them.
Goremaker, Shard of the Red Mountain

During the war of the Primordials, the eternal lovers Anathëa and Moros organized an assault on the Red Mountain, the throne of Ashtaroth, Lord of Flesh. Amidst the raging battle, the ground quaked as they realized the landscape itself was alive and about to engulf everything. They had no other choice than to obliterate the whole organic mountain to survive. This could very well be one of its shards that survived throughout the eons.

Big Bill was a blacksmith's apprentice. But repairing horses’ irons bored him, he dreamed about being as an evil-slashing hero with the sharpest axe the world had ever known. The blacksmithing prodigy got to work, every night he would hammer hard at the anvil, shaping his lethal ambitions into an axe he would call ‘Edgy’.\n\nRumor has it that Big Bill accidentally beheaded himself at night while training in the backyard. Yet, Edgy remains as a deadly work of art.

One man absolutely dominated the Stormfall Arena Championship during its golden age: the legendary “Willbreaker”. Where most gladiators bought into the dogma that victory was about killing your competitors, he however simply chose to outlive them while putting on a good show. His strategy mostly consisted of wearing down his foes with blocks and deflects, before finishing them with lethal counterattacks.\n\nThe Willbreaker was undefeated for fifteen years and retired from the blood sport to die of old age. He outlived all of his foes, all of those that bet for or against him as well as those that hired him as a gladiator in the first place.

The battle for creation was raging. Old alliances showed great heroism but were losing the fight nonetheless. To avoid the end of times, Moros, the Primordial of Dusk, rode into battle on a gigantic shadow chimaera whose wings covered the entire battlefield.\n\nHe flew directly to his offspring to confront him: the Fallen conqueror leading this unstoppable army. Knowing he would not win the fight in time, Moros tethered himself to his foe and banished himself into the abyss. Both of them were trapped by the ritual, but his dreaded shadow-beast survived and flew away. A scale lost by the creature was then forged into this shield, and it might be the only evidence that the creature ever existed.

These are the symbols engraved on the blade. This type of dagger is known as a “Senate’s Imperatum”, a custom-made weapon that serves only one purpose: to terminate a specific target. These are forged alongside the paperwork when the Senate of the “United Republic of Mankind” decides that a certain target must be taken out.\n\nThis particular one, still coated with lethal poison, was carried by an expert assassin to take out an Eos, a general of the Brotherhood of Dawn, named Gernese. The operation ended with a failed assassination and the agent being obliterated by his target.

Anakan’s ingenuity was only matched by two things, his social anxiety and his laziness. As a farmboy, he crafted a metal stick crowned by an energy crystal that could discharge a tiny amount of electricity in order to force the unruly cattle into their boxes. One day, the boys in town plotted a prank against him and charged the energy crystal with an enneract they had luckily found in a field. The next day, Anakan used the staff to gently shock the rear of a reluctant cow. It created a massive lightning shockwave that fried him alive along with the cows, the farm and all the pranksters that were hidden nearby to watch the show. Only the Zapstick remained.

In the mountainous village of Rigard, there used to be a revered idol at the center of the small town. A maiden representing peace, fertility and the celebration of winter’s end. A work of art created generations ago by the village's stonemasons.\n\nWhen the hamlet got threatened by raiders, the town folks realized that they had no iron to create weapons. Hopeless, their stonemason took it upon himself to tear down the statue and reshape it into a weapon of war, a heavy stoneblade that he could wield to defend his home. While the place lost its symbol of peace, to this day its people still celebrate the coming of spring.

As the Primordial of Change tore himself apart, the Trinity birthed from his end. Abanazaar, Beelmalik and Etheliel finally obtained the opportunity to be independent beings rather than afterthoughts stuck inside a divine psyche. But while Etheliel was the one that bolstered the ego of her brothers to stir their host from the inside, she was stung with remorse the moment she became tangible and free. Her cold embrace tried to convince Abanazar to merge back with her and Beelmalik, but his burning desire to make the world his own was too strong. At that moment, she shed her first frozen tear for him, which later was forged into this sword.

Abanazaar considered his sister’s plea. As dawn peaked on the horizon, a complex emotion of wonderment and hunger led to his realization: her sins were not his own, and so he refused to let go of his existence. He wanted the sun for himself, his decision confirming the beginning of his descent into madness.\n\nHe did not speak to voice his refusal. Gazing deep into his sister’s eyes, the air itself started to catch fire from the intensity of his determination. As the immortal flames came in contact with her ice-cold skin, the sparks froze and fell to the ground. This sword was forged from one of those immortal embers.

The bludgeon of this mace seems to be a prisoner's ball that got cut from the chain and the captive then added rough scraps of metal as spikes.\n\nThat’s when he got to work, smashing the heads of his slavers left and right until he was finally free. None of his captors survived him. The mace was eventually found, firmly held by the corpse of the self-freed slave, as if even in death he was fighting for his freedom.

The handle of this axe looks like the spine of a human being, from which the blade has grown and mutated in a gruesome and disgusting way.\n\nThis axe used to have a name: Kelsir. A cultist that worshipped Ashtaroth, the Fallen Lord of Flesh, accepted the honor to mutate into a weapon in the name of his evil overseer. To be sure, lunatics find themselves at home within the cult of the Aberrant.

Beelmalik, Fallen Lord of Punishment, rules over the Upheaval Tribunal. This seat of power is sealed from all mortals except for the Entropic Judges, humans handpicked and groomed by the Fallen himself to be instruments of his will and leaders of his cult.\n\nEach of those mighty servants are given a key that grants them access to the Tribunal. Zephyron is one of those lethal artifacts.

The United Republic of Mankind has three armies. The Liberators are in charge of foreign campaigns against the three enemy crowns. They aim to destroy their witchcraft and beliefs and assimilate them as part of a modern, united republican state.\n\nElite tactical troops of the Liberators use the “Regicide Mark II” pistol model as their best ranged multi-purpose weapon. The powerful Mark III has only ever been a prototype that got discontinued by the Senate because of its insane per-unit cost and a recoil that too few men could handle.

The Battle of Carrion Keep remains famous in the warfare history of the Purifiers, the Republican army in charge of dealing with the supernatural. Ambushed by evil forces in the Mudlands surrounding the nefarious keep, most men were slaughtered in a crushing defeat for the Republic. Justicar Heimlock, one of the men left behind, made his fame by resurfacing alone several months later in the Senate, with the heads of the two enemy leaders as an offering. Historians quickly praised his bravery and treated Carrion Keep as a victory of the Republic, quickly promoting Heimlock to an Inquisitor. Even to this day, there is still no explanation as to how he managed that extraordinary feat.

Originally used by a Frost Tormentor, it was salvaged and researched by Vargian clan of occultists. Earl Tolna ordered them to repair it so that he could wield it in a final resort against an invading Republican regiment. Such a command was unheard of, and was guaranteed to get the Earl court-martialed.\n\nHowever, with his first blow hundreds of souls burst out of the weapon, flooding the battlefield. They wreaked havoc on both armies, killing and consuming the mortal soldiers indiscriminately. In the end, all that remained were corpses, cold to the touch, and this mace, a shining prison, daring someone more worthy to wield it.

As it often does, the Sea of Torment summoned a flash storm, sending the Arman II ricocheting between the waves. Her crew sealed in the hold, sails down, one unlucky sailor was stranded in the crow’s nest, his trusty pistol his only company.\n\nA huge wave suddenly struck the ship, sending the gun flying. At the apex of its flight, it was struck by lightning, protecting the ship. It fell to the deck, slipping into the hull. On returning to port, the electrified pistol was insulated with diamonds and will forever channel the power of the sea.

A tsunami in the Baktoraï Archipelago unearthed a long-dormant cave network of shifting golden metal that was neither manmade nor natural. Oliver Macksfesten, the intrepid explorer, found this artifact on his first expedition, an enneract hundreds of times more powerful than any other.\n\nToo volatile to be converted into energy, it was sold to the Cabal of Illumination for research. An Ascended attempted to absorb its power, but the raw energy burst their body into fleshy chunks. Its aura of magic can empower any sorceror daring enough to wield it.

On the Kuei Empire coast, he headed the Republican Liberator fleet with his unit of shieldbearers against the city of Tourmica. Landing on the shores, his scythe led the Republic’s expansion. Dashing from skirmish to skirmish, he cut through soldiers like wheat as the shieldbearers absorbed counter-strikes. In the melee, his unit became surrounded by enemy cavalry. The scythe ignited with lightning as he swung in a wide circle, arcs of electricity paralysing the horses. The fallen riders were swiftly decapitated, the electrified blade cauterising their severed necks. A master of death, they called him The Reaper.

Fairy tales speak of a woman bathed in shade who roams the world of Wolcen, dancing gracefully throughout the land. She appears and fades away on a whim, her fan cutting through the air, its movement summoning a mollifying breeze.\n\nOnce, she appeared often as many invited her soothing presence. But when a sorcerer stole her phylactery for his rituals, nightmares crept back into the dreams of those she’d been healing. She untethered herself from her captive phylactery at the cost of much of her power, and now passes unseen in the world.
Engraved along the staff:\n\n“An aching hunger drives me forward. Constant temptation, an interminable quest, craving for power.”

Ebba of Varg awoke swaddled in seaweed, two hundred feet away from her shipwreck. She found a wrought-iron joint in the debris: a miracle. With it, she fashioned a ramshackle bow stringed with plant fibres to hunt the beasts of the Baktorai islands.\n\nWhen Macksfesten found her and had her board his ship, she threw the bow overboard and announced: “Here’s a miracle for the next castaway.”
Sopping wet. The fabric is starting to chafe. Still better than drowning in full plate.
Caked in mud and heavy with water.
Never very fashionable, which is why it was worn under armor.
Thin and fragile, but the armored boots were too heavy to stay afloat.

Bezeriel grew fond of observing a beautiful maiden from the tribes of the First Men, so exuberant was she. Taking the shape of a pale charming man, he offered her this ring to show his admiration.\n\nShe smiled as she put the ring to her finger, but it was not to last: Her skin started to wither, her lifeforce consumed and absorbed within the ring’s gem in a matter of seconds. Her body was never found, for all that remained of her was dust.

Isolated far east of the Four Realms of Men, the frontier city-state of Gomora is infamously known for being the only settlement that openly welcomes evil worshippers. The champions in charge of keeping them in check are known as Arbiters and receive a powerful onyx ring as a symbol of their absolute judgements.

It would be impossible to determine who or what this uncanny tooth belonged to. When you first picked it up, the ivory was of a pristine white. But now a faint coating of blood started to redden the canine by its base. Where is that blood coming from? Could it be yours? Only one thing is sure: it’s hungry, hungry for more.
Belt of the Owl Mighty Tester
Looks like Owlcen hid a little present for you!

O’Maley had collected lucky charms his whole life, attaching them to his belt so that he could become the luckiest man alive. And he did. It’s only on his deathbed when his last servant slipped on a sock and broke his neck, that he realized that luck is always balanced.\n\nFor him to be so fortuitous, others around him had to be severely unlucky. All the people that he cherished eventually got hurt and died due to the vacuum of luck that this belt would create around him.

When the kingdom of Alia crumbled on itself due to a political revolution, it led to its rebirth as the URM: the United Republic of Mankind. This new warmongering faction promptly pushed the frontiers of all its neighbors in an attempt to absorb them all in a single state.\n\nThey retaliated by creating the Three Crowns’ alliance, gathering Laibon, Varg and Kuei. These rare brooches were given to spies and messengers that had capital information to carry through Republican territory between the allies.

Long before the world’s great cataclysms, the elemental forces that sustained the Primordial of Change split from him. He ceased to exist and became three: one avatar of Fire, one of Ice and one of Lightning. Yet, some residual energy escaped and tried to find a host to stabilize itself. It journeyed among the first humans, creators of the Enneracts: wise and mighty humans sheltered by Primordials. One of them, a powerful psychic, accidentally absorbed that vanishing energy. His skull fried and crystalized instantly from the raw power he was consuming. Part of this skull was found and ornamented by successive dynasties, until people eventually forgot all about its mythical origin.

The plate armor of Eos Hadrian, legendary leader of the Brotherhood of Dawn. He remained famous in history for being the only one daring enough to use the “Helion” centuries ago, an artefact given by Anathëa to be used as a last recourse should humans face absolute extinction.\n\nAt mankind’s darkest hour, he was left with no other choice than to use it and summon the Lady of Dawn in her full glory. Bathing in her sacred lights, his armor permanently absorbed part of her radiance, imbuing it with tremendous power.

“Power. Destruction. Conquest. I am A-dra-ma-lech. I bring war. And from now on, so do you.” Something truly powerful and nefarious uses that spaulder as a relic: A demon sent by Baäpheth, the Fallen Archduke of War. Even if the entity wishes to assist you right now, no wise man would take his chances. The promise of power always has a dreadful cost.

Thirty-five years ago, the Vargian city of Argand chose to shelter a devious cult within its walls. The population celebrated the newfound prosperity while accepting the unspeakable horrors the authorities had to perform to sustain this unholy alliance. But the Primordial of Purity was on the hunt: the cult was fueling power to a Fallen he was tracking. Sarisel appeared at the gates of Argand and butchered the entire population to force the evil cult to reveal itself. Only children were spared during the cleansing, most of them sheltering themselves within the high temple’s sanctum around a revered energy crystal. The litany of cries mixed with the energy deployed by Sarisel empowered the gem with a magic that no mortal should possess.

The moral depravity of the inhabitants of the Baktoraï archipelago is no secret to any traveler. Yet, the empty halls of Summerwind Manor are an haunting testament to the depths of their cruelty. While priding themselves on their youth and beauty, the Summerwind sisters saw their mother’s elegance decay with age. Refusing to share her fate, they made a pact with dark forces to retain their youth forever. Nefarious rings with the ability to consume the lifeforce of other maidens soon appeared on their frail hands. Rumor has it that their evil is scattered throughout the four realms after their “resources” ran dry around Summerwind Manor.

A hand-me-down from the Purple Phoenix, these boots are perfect for sprinting across the battlefield. The left boot has a pocket full of mints and the right one a hidden compartment for old sentimental letters. However, these cleats are one-of-a-kind: there’s a large ‘E’ stitched on the inside of each shoe.

As servants to the Primordials, it is said the First Men were offered gifts to help them carry out their work. A remnant from eons past, this bracer sends surging energy through your body, empowering your soul with the will of those that have gone before you.

In his weakened state, Moros has almost no presence within the mortal plain. His time in the Abyss drags on, living in a purgatory of ceaseless combat. However, when the moon covers the sun in an all-shrouding eclipse, he can look upon his followers for a brief moment and receive a fraction of their prayers.\n\nSo say the Sages of Twilight, the spiritual guardians of the Cult of Moros.

As the Flayers raided a Stormfall caravan, a young noble was taken prisoner. Howling with pleasure, they cut the skin from his back and tied him to a bed of nails. To muffle his cries, they made a mask of cured skin and sewed it to his neck. The next day, Thunderblades stormed the camp, scattering the wildlings. The noble healed but kept the mask. He wore the hood while he trained his body, dedicating his life to vengeance.\n\nAfter years of intensive preparation, he returned to that camp. What were once Flayers had become settlers. Children played where their parents had once cured human flesh. But he hungered for vengeance, and his desire had to be sated.

As Dusk and Dawn intertwined in impassioned dance, mortal life was inspired by their union. There was conflict amongst the Primordials about the place of humanity; their disagreements soon became a full-blown war. Legends say that Dusk and Dawn combined their powers to establish the mythic Army of Genesis.

The military commander of the Cult of Bezeriel, the Fallen Archduke of Doom, was known for her torture methods. Despite her skeletal, lanky frame, her great strength was fueled by cruelty. Dark magic, tainted fire and putrid instruments allowed her to outwit her foes, sapping their strength as her concoctions and incisions reduced their bodies to diseased husks.\n\nThose who survived would suffer a terrible fate; some were consumed alive by maggots, others force-fed their own organs, but she always got the information she desired.

Kardis, the Blackstaff of Gomora, was born into the Cult of Bezeriel. Her mother, a competent witch, dreamt of becoming Bezeriel’s champion and joined the ritual. As the rite began, she was soon overwhelmed, unable to control the power of death. Crying in pain, the witch suddenly collapsed on the bier, dead. Watching an Immortal Maw devour her mother’s corpse, Kardis had to flee. She escaped, taking only her mother’s amulet. She poured her rage into the necklace and swore to become a powerful sorceress to wipe her city of its sins. Her fervent desire to cleanse Gomora twisted the pendant into the symbol of the Jewel of the Pariahs. How she lost her treasured amulet is a mystery.

An original piece of Purifier armor, crafted by the late Lerin Erich. The design was created to impale leaping demonspawn but had the secondary function of looking imposing.\n\nA trend of increasingly large and flamboyant shoulder guards began, with other armorers plagiarising Lerin’s concept and stealing his business. Shoulder guard size became synonymous with rank, leaving the original design to be worn only by frontline infantry. Despite his stylistic influence Lerin Erich fell into anonymity, and died a pauper.

The Cult of Sarisel is an evangelical secret order with a strict hierarchical structure. Every stage of initiation involves sacred rites testing the ability to cleanse all forms of impurity. Initiates have to kill immoral people from their past lives, corrupted animals and even fellow recruits with perceived darkness in their hearts.\n\nCompleting the full initiation process grants you a cincture of sanctity, a magical object that allows you to detect evil in any creature, the first step in becoming an Untainted.

The rituals of the Cult of Etheliel are cruel and superficial. Youths of indisputable elegance are kidnapped from their homes and frozen alive, preserving their beauty in ice forever.\n\nThey are sedated and dressed in fine clothing, before they are slowly, delicately frozen from head to toe. The men are depicted as handsome war heroes, with specially forged ceremonial armor. Incredibly heavy and cold to the touch, it maintains the ice’s integrity as well as overstating the strength of its wearer.

Captain James and his crew were drinking rum, Purses empty, the atmosphere was glum. He schemed and he wondered, “Where is the gold?” Archion Treasury, that it did hold! He called his men and yelled “Anchors aweigh!” And started a heist in the light of day. His crew stormed the bank, and soon found the safe, Wielding sword and gun, James fought like a wraith. With drunk eyes aglow with glimmering gold, More archers arrived, and turned their sweat cold. The captain dashed and escaped drunkenly, Dodged ev’ry shot; his hat not so lucky.

The horns bellow. The banners are raised. The battle begins. The clansmen storm the hall, mighty roars fill the air. Roasted birds pulled to pieces in an instant, the cartilage snaps like dry wood. Tough bread is ripped apart, tension on both sides mounting until the loaf yields. Whole hogs impaled repeatedly, slabs of flesh and crystallized fat are torn from the bones and consumed greedily. Red wine is toasted and spilled in revelry, waves of viscous liquid bathing the battlefield in a burgundy haze. This is what it means to be a Blood Tear raider.

The first leader of the Blood Tear Clan wore this armor as a sign of his leadership. When he fell in battle, the warrior who avenged him took the breastplate for herself. A cycle of death and promotion began, and soon devolved into treachery. For decades, ambitious raiders cut down their own leaders to claim the armor and its influence.\n\nHowever, when Einjar joined the clan he appointed himself as leader with charismatic authority; no-one protested. He took the historic brigandine and threw it onto the loot pile to be sold, solidifying his legacy to come.

As the Republic continues its campaign of conquest, the earth trembles at their might.This 'noble' crusade threatens the great Kingdom of Varg and its clans. Many clans, from established dynasties to reclusive sects, refuse to cooperate due to petty disputes.\n\nThe Bronze Wolves are a militia created by Countess Odelia, recruiting soldiers across Varg to face the Republican menace. She aims to unite the clans with political guile and bargaining to amass an unbeatable army, with burnished bronze armor so lustrous that its shine can be seen for miles.

For centuries, every child in C’tul has taken the Hunter’s Oath as a rite of passage. Tracking an animal, killing and butchering it; the hunter’s life is determined by the animal they catch. Once, a boy walked into the forest unarmed, following the voices of spirits.\n\nFour days later, he returned unharmed with the head of a spiral-horned black antelope, a mythical beast of old legends. The skull was like nothing anyone had ever seen, a trophy unlike any other. He became C’tul’s first shaman, guiding lost spirits to their place of rest.

Sani Skinslip, better known as the Sani the Seer, was an infamous drug-smuggler from Three-Peaks. The High Abbots of the city would create potent psychedelics and invigorating powders, which were forbidden amongst the general population, to push their soothsayers to their fullest potential.\n\nSani used his light fingers and the secret compartment in his ring to obtain small quantities of these substances, self-medicating with the fumes that emanated through the cap. That is, he did, until he was stabbed unceremoniously in a backstreet.

These boots are used by Archion’s Departed to manipulate gravity and slow their terminal velocity, allowing them to leap from the flying city and explore the frontier wilderness below. The previous owner of this pair was killed in the hostile wildlands, but her body was found by Blue, the most secluded known human.\n\nBlue recognised the ranger as a recruit he had instructed, once wide-eyed and brimming with enthusiasm. He returned the boots to Archion, offering them to the family of the deceased with his condolences.

An incredible piece of technology taken from the subterranean laboratory of the Cult of Ezaneal, the Bio-Flow Symbiosis Armor converts chemical energy into electricity, turning its wearer into a living generator. The pipes transfer fluid directly into the body, harvesting electricity from the movement within the wearer’s circulatory system. Bursts of adrenaline can supercharge machinery, allowing the technology to unleash its full potential with a uniquely powerful hormone.

“Our mutual friend”, they called her. Triss had a talent for being everyone’s friend, giving the right gossip in the right place and forcing a lord into abdication in the same breath. But people missed the unglamorous aspect of the job: crawling through waste to hide a piece of intel, surviving on military rations for months in Laibon’s deserts, hiding behind crusty goggles to take a shot at a twelve year old heiress.\n\nThe truth was that all those Republican bureaucrats had better hope they were her friend. One never knows who Triss’ binoculars will point at next.

Though most servants of Etheliel embrace the cold, the champion Vidar stays wrapped in Whitefield seal skins. He externalizes the frost magic from his body, emanating such a chill that his arrowheads fragment on contact but his purpose in this action isn’t war. He’s trying to recall the warmth of his mortal days; how the fire comforted them as he gutted fish beside his father. Still now, he’ll wrap himself in his father’s coat, so the Whitefield natives might mistake him for one of them. Memories remain, but no matter how he searches, Vidar can’t find the emotions taken by the cold.

The nameless one awoke in the middle of smoking rubble, confused yet untouched by the fires. Bodies everywhere, dried and tangled. All ornaments had burned away, but for a glint of gold in a cadaver’s fist. It was a medallion, upon closer examination, pulsing with a furious energy. He felt his chest thrum with rage again, when the shadow spirit that had soothed him reappeared. This amulet, she told him, was a symbol of those he had hurt. So long as he carried it, he should remember not to do harm.

When Arran Brightgale drove off the Republican occupation in Lejre, he unknowingly rescued a delegation of blacksmiths from Vulkaïn. These skilled metalworkers thanked him with a full suit of armor made in their lava-forged style. The platelegs anchored Arran to the ground, and roused him with flashes of ancient victories in the midst of great horrors.\n\nThough he couldn’t charge as he once had, being so heavy, the material made him an immovable eye of the storm on the frontlines.

As a boy, Kiraan the Plaguebringer visited the terminally ill in Prestwich. Under the guise of compassion, he would drape his overcoat over their plague-wracked bodies, and listen to their mundane stories as disease imbued the garment. He began his first experimentations on the nature of pestilence with those samples. Now, as a masterful necromancer, he wants to suspend the whole of humanity in that malady. Sustained with undead energy, the sick would live on in eternal torture as their bodies turn gangrenous. An endless source of desperation to feed Kiraan’s patron, the ever-hungering Bezeriel, Fallen Archduke of Doom.

A passage is engraved in the leather. Tenet CCLVII: "To keep the body clean from abyssal stigma, engraved on the skin should be the terms of banishment, or no exorcism be taken on." Tenet CCLVIII: "A peaceable demon is a lying demon. Do not concede kindness to deceivers: such kindness is corruption." Tenet CCLIX: "Recall the terms of banishment: “The earthly body shall be pestilent to your tongue. The water that sates us shall be a plague to your body. I commit you to the abyss: out, out, out."
“I know how you kill, I know where you worship, I know who you are, Because you were me.”

Alastor #273 fixes his mind on his target. Everything beyond that is a grey fog, excepting the tools of war ready for his usage. The energy from Ezaneal’s device is magnetic, leading him from one impact to the next. He hasn’t rested in years; he doesn't need to. Every warm body he cuts down feeds him with an electric pulse.

For a while, the greatest scourge that ever afflicted Abanazaar, Beelmalik, and Etheliel’s cults was a raggedy elder. “Prophet” Ashoret, who’d stalk their members and raze their meeting places with disastrous hurricanes. He took a sash from each cult’s high priest as a trophy. By tying all three together, Ashoret was able to conjure a glimpse of each Abbathus’ elemental power, while channeling his faith to the long-forgotten Primordial of Change. A frail man with the strength of storms.

Squires among the Brotherhood of Dawn are eager to fight on behalf of the Lady. But when they sit among their brethren at home to hear the Hierophant’s hymns resonating from their torcs, they form a true bond to her. They recall their lessons telling how her Song, amplified by Hephaaron’s neck rings, granted her togetherness with Moros and bolstered the first movement of life. When they set their swords aside awhile, they do the work of healing themselves.

Tissarine is a particular delight for visiting diplomats; workshops overflow with the highest grade of crafts, the streets bustle with friendly, well-fed citizens, and best of all, guests get to leave with a gorgeous armour piece and a humble request not to divulge the location. Curious? Not as much as the mistress of the domain herself. The tale tells that this town rose to meet her every need. Maids, cooks, blacksmiths, even bounty hunters bringing Black Aster flowers. Freed of common chores, she cloisters herself in her mansion, a mystery even to her subjects.

Voidforging is a perilous gamble. A demonologist will draw ritual circles before creating a bridge to the Abyss and allowing a single demon to enter the mortal world. They’ll collect a small quantity of Abyssal residue from the entity’s bound body and swiftly cast the creature back into the Abyss. Voidforged items can be dangerous, especially with long-term use, but their unique magical properties make them invaluable.

At adulthood, Zima began to hear spirits call out to her. She longed to help them, and followed their cries to a cursed tree, both living and dead: burgeoning offshoots grew from its branches while the roots rotted.\n\nShe carved a ring from the cracked wood, engraving it with a totemic symbol. Her thoughts echoed in response to the spirits for the first time. With her newfound ability, she would guide lost souls to Eriebe, realm of the dead.

The process of creating an Entropy Orb is a dangerous endeavour that most of the time leads to the death of its creator. First, one would have to obtain an Erieban Tear and an Abyssal Tear, then the daring artificer would have to engage in a merging ritual, encasing the creative force within the void. \n\nThe mistake that spells the doom of most ritualists is failing to encase the creative force, instead allowing the void to feed on it, which causes a chain reaction leading to an implosion from which no human can survive.

Should one be rich, lucky, or powerful enough to gather an Abyssal Tear and an Erieban Tear, there are rumors of a new type of energy that can be generated from this pairing of opposites. An echo of a force that knows no parallel, something that powerful scholars and supernatural entities alike have no explanation for to this day.

<Font Size="15">Adds a new random magic effect when used on an item. It will consume all socketed gems to guarantee a new magic effect whose power depends on the gems' level, and whose type is chosen randomly among all the types of gems on the item.

\n\nThis item cannot be applied on legendary and unique items.</Font>

What happens after the end of a mortal life? While most compensate for their ignorance by finding refuge in spirituality, others become obsessed with what lies beyond the Veil of Death.\n\nSome shamans and necromancers even managed to interact with the inacessible land of the dead known as "Eriebe". Through ill-gotten knowledge, an even rarer few have learned to lure specters and souls through the Veil of Death, and harvest the residual energy those entities carry in from Eriebe./n/nThese cold energy orbs have unique properties, rumour telling they can be transformed into any kind of matter or energy in the proper hands.

<Font Size="15">Removes a random magic effect when used on an item. It will consume all socketed gems to guarantee keeping a magic effect whose type is chosen randomly among all the types of gems on the item. Greater gems power allow the keeping of higher level magic effects.
\n\nThis item cannot be applied on legendary and unique items.</Font>

Demonologists and scholars of the supernatural have theorized voidcrafting for generations. Only the most daring or powerful of them manage the extraordinary feat of summoning a demon from the abyss and harvesting the residual Abyssal energy that clings to it.\n\nBut for those that delve into that art, it can also become a very lucrative endeavour to sell those abyssal orbs to those that know how to use them.

Drag and drop this item in the box of the Expedition Map interface near "Dashing Eugene"
Access a dungeon with an higher amount of chests.
Wherever that map may lead you, the promise of riches is embedded into it.
Access a dungeon with an higher population of Wealth Omens.

Many believe that sighting a golden scarab is an event that predates success and wealth. It comes with no surprise that greedy entrepreneurs nicknamed "Omen Hunters" decided to capitalize on that popular belief to track these mysterious creatures and sell their location for an hefty profit.
Access a dungeon guarded by its boss.

The four realms have no shortage of creatures, otherwordly entities, and devious humans to fill bounty hunting boards. The way of the sellsword guarantees never being in need for coins: successful ones have no shortage of it while unsuccessful ones don't last long enough to have any need for wealth.
Access a dungeon guarded by its boss and his powerful guards.

Lords and Kings themselves can be overwhelmed by surges of ominous forces on their territory. Call-to-arms exists for that reason, beaconing for heroes and elite sellswords to do the dirty work for them. It is also much cheaper than to mobilize an entire army.
Access a room full of cursed chests with a limited time to loot them all.

These rare mystical mushrooms can only grow on the graves of ascended humans. Following specific rites and preparations, they make for a potent incense powder with unique properties.The reveries their fumes bring can be both lethal and wonderful. They are often used to test the mind and body.
Access a dungeon full of chests with a limited time to loot them all.

Greedleaf dust became very expensive and rare when psychic seers discovered a way to extract its mind enhancing property. Some say the reveries its Incense fumes bring can manifest the deepest desires to the inhaler.
Access a dungeon full of Wealth Omens with a limited time to track, kill and loot them all.

Popular belief is that the precious Goldroot is the favourite plant of creatures nicknamed "Wealth Omens". So much so that the two seem to have a mystical connection. Failed alchemists have for a long time tried to transform that plant into a powerful incense that could reveal the bond between the two. Goldroot dust have recently surfaced on blackmarkets indicating that at least one of them has succeeded...
Access a room full of chests and loot their reward.

The existence of such maps is often a story of its own. An heirloom hidden away, a pirate's booty, a group of adventurers that murdered each other at the moment of sharing… for this peculiar one, its story was indeed lost, but its riches however are very much real.
Access a room full of cursed chests and loot their reward.

Even greed has limits. Adventurers and explorers finding the location of protected, cursed, or possessed treasures might not always dare to claim them. Yet, they always pinpoint its location, selling the map might be enough of a reward for those lacking ambition.
Access a room to fight the empowered version of a familiar boss.

An incense concocted in the wilderness surrounding Three Peaks. If listened to closely, the echoes of forgotten memories can be felt crawling into your ears, wiggling their way into your head and making room for their cursed remembrance. You can hear the familiar sucking of flesh, the looming redness of an unfathomable creature, and a name that you thought would never be uttered again: Lambach.

"Chop! Chop! It's time for some killing boys! Show me what your guts are made of!" Almarik, Shock Infantryman _________________________________________________________ Most armies create their own mythos, populated with larger-than-life heroes that give troops examples to look-up to. Detractors often dismiss them as artificial myths created to fuel the war propaganda that surrounds them. Yet, the one known as "Soldier Almarik" is very real. Despite his prowess, he made his name by willingly keeping the lowest rank in the Purifiers' army. Burdening himself with anything other than the art of killing would not fit his style. His home is the battlefield.
Attacks and Spells are more likely to be Critical Hits.

"If you take a hit, you hit 'em back twice. One to take 'em out, and the other to fuck up their corpse." His home is the battlefield.
Taking Damage gives you more Rage.

"Purifiers protect mankind from the supernatural evils of the world... tsk, bunch of pompous twats! I merely play along that rubbish as long as they let me slaugther stuff for them!" When below a certain threshold of Health your Health Regeneration is triggered. This Effect has a Cooldown.

"The strong dominate the weak. No negotiation, no compromise. The mightiest of warriors deserve the greatest wealth, and we will take it by force." Einjar, Thane of the Blood Tear Clan _________________________________________________________ Every civilization has horrendous tales of barbarian hordes murdering, pillaging and raiding innocent people. Most of the time these exaggerated stories are meant to give shivers during the long winter nights. But these nightmarish depictions of violence caught up with fiction when the Ravagers of the Blood Tear stormed the lands of Varg. A terrifying warrior depicted as a whirlwind of iron and gore has risen as their new warlord. In his aura they seem to have reached new depths of savagery: cannibalism, blood rituals, dismemberments... the madness knows no bounds.
Physical, Toxic and Rend damage is increased. You cannot inflict other Damage Types.

"Mortal danger brings out the best in a warrior. Being surrounded by an overwhelming number of enemies will turn you into a creature of war, an unstoppable being of death. If you survive that is." Increased Damage for each Enemy within Melee Range.

"We do not sow but we harvest. We join the crows for a feast. Our table is the battlefield!" Give all forms of damage Life Leech. Life Leech heals you on the next tick of Health Regeneration.

"No more weapons from the Republic! No more bribes from Varg! Now they die, they all die in an endless requiem of gore and laments! My axe thirsts!" A percentage of Physical Damage becomes Rend Damage.

"The Kingless are supposed to protect Laibon. Yet, criminality runs amok throughout the kingdom, and the Kingless refuse to intervene. I would rather die searching for a dead man than waste my life following hollow principles." Mah'alam, fifth shield of the Kingless _________________________________________________________ The kingdom of Laibon has a strong history of assigning their best warriors to the protection of their ruler. Yet, a few decades ago their king disappeared following a series of tragic events. Since then, these warriors became "The Kingless", training day and night purposelessly but ever ready to fulfill their oath should the crown return. One of them however chose not to wait any longer: he left the realm to track down clues of his sovereign's whereabouts. Should there be nothing left to protect then he would avenge him, and bring back the crown for a new king to take the throne.
Blocking a Hit provides you and your Allies with an increased All Resistances Score Buff.

"The first shield of the Kingless used to tell us: 'Should one of us fall, do not mourn. Do not offer that to your foe. Instead, pick up the shield of the fallen, and bash the skull of your enemy with it.' If my king died, I dare not think of the pain I will unleash on the murderer." "Our ruler is a man-god, a beacon of light gifted with secrets of creation! His lineage kept our realm safe from the long night for centuries... but now that he disappeared with no descendants, we can only fear the worse for our lands." "The bounty of our holy ruler was limitless. No-one went hungry and the silos were full. When his divine inspiration departed, so too did our resources. Now that we are at our most desperate, it's a small miracle that we survive at all." Health Globes will now provide a temporary Buff to your Resistances as well as Healing you.

"We move on horseback but we strike on foot. They should never hear us coming, for if they do we face certain death. By the time they realize they are getting flanked, we should already be back to our mounts and going. I don't want anyone playing hero on this squad." Triss, The Flying Dragoon _________________________________________________________ Intelligence gathering is the key to successful warfare. Such a pretty sentence is a staple taught in Republican military academies, yet those few words have very real implications on the field. There is an ever growing need for discrete and fast soldiers able to track opposing forces' positions, work behind enemy lines or even infiltrate them for sabotage. They are the backbone that allows Inquisitors to make sound strategic decisions. One of them made a name for herself among Republican troops: The Flying Dragoon, a scout from a squad of light cavalry dedicated to harassing the enemy's supply chain. Her reputation states that she is so effective that her sabotages alone are enough to shatter opposing troops' morale.
Your Attack and Spell Casting Speed is increased.

"Many generals say that fear is the enemy. They sit comfortably, directing units miles away from the bloodshed. When you are discovered in enemy territory and you have to run for your life, fear may be the only thing that keeps you alive." Triss, The Flying Dragoon _________________________________________________________ Intelligence gathering is the key to successful warfare. Such a pretty sentence is a staple taught in Republican military academies, yet those few words have very real implications on the field. There is an ever growing need for discrete and fast soldiers able to track opposing forces' positions, work behind enemy lines or even infiltrate them for sabotage. They are the backbone that allows Inquisitors to make sound strategic decisions. One of them made a name for herself among Republican troops: The Flying Dragoon, a scout from a squad of light cavalry dedicated to harassing the enemy's supply chain. Her reputation states that she is so effective that her sabotages alone are enough to shatter opposing troops' morale.
Gain additional Stamina Points while at low Health. This Effect has a Cooldown.

"If you want to get a feel of the enemy, join him. Standing armies or evil cults, it matters not. You have to think and move like one of them if you want to survive. The hardest part still, will always be to break character and slip out for a report." "A thousand poisons for a thousand purposes." Li-Wei, Master of the Jade Legion _________________________________________________________ Most of the Kuei Empire's territory is covered in jungle. Its cities are connected by a network of traderoads regularly patrolled by imperial troops. But for the past fifteen years, the Jade Legion has been harassing caravans with ambushes all over the empire. Their elusive nature has shrouded them in myths concerning their motives and habits. To this day, one of the best kept secrets of the emperor is that the current Jade Legion's leader is an imperial agent working for him. He infiltrated them, assassinated the previous leader and took his place. Now, the emperor puppets the Jade Legion to justify exuberant taxes over all the cities under his dominion.
A percentage of Physical Damage is converted into Toxic Damage.

"I've seen so many Departed die from the treachery of these lands. Warning them of the horrors they will face does not change their fate... you have to be there. You have to see for yourself. If you survive them once, you might survive them twice and eventually you might call yourself prepared for anything." Blue, Ranger of the Departed and most secluded known human _________________________________________________________ Like a migratory bird, the flying city of Archion follows a nomadic lifestyle. It has three anchorage points, its easternmost is above a lagoon on the coast of one of the two unexplored continents, making it the most exposed city to the exotic evils of the unknown. Once a year, the Departed, a troop made of brave rangers, are sent out to map these frontier lands. Few return, and those that do often come back with mental diseases festering in their mind. All know that they should never stay longer than a night out there... except for "Blue", a lone wolf which learned how to survive on his own for weeks. To this day, Blue hasn't shared his secret nor the wonders that he discovered out there.
Projectiles that Hit an Enemy at close range Pierce them, meaning that the Projectile can Hit other Enemies behind them.

"Tracking an animal is like getting to know them. Beyond the curled teeth and barbed tail, you see where they eat, where they sleep, where they hunt.
